snippet: As a growing number of South Koreans are dying alone with no relative willing to claim their remains and perform a final ritual, an activist and his organization help to fill the void.
abstract: Number of civic groups in South Korea provide funerals for people who do not have families or relatives willing to claim their remains when they die; growing number of South Koreans are dying alone, trend that illustrates demographic and economic shift in country that many say started during financial crisis in late 1990s when lifetime employment, once unquestioned in South Korea, vanished.
lead_paragraph: As a growing number of South Koreans are dying alone with no relative willing to claim their remains and perform a final ritual, an activist and his organization help to fill the void.

headline.main: A Lonely End for South Koreans Who Cannot Afford to Live, or Die
headline.print_headline: Saying Goodbye, When No One Else Will
